articles.description: Open source ovladač Nouveau pro grafické karty NVIDIA měl chybu typu use-after-free v jádře 6.3. Bylo doporučeno se těmto jádrům zatím vyhnout. Chyba byla celkem rychle opravena a poslána do jádra 6.4.
articles.title: Problém Nouveau s jádrem 6.3 vyřešen v 6.3.9

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jirka Setnička)
articles.description: Matfyz již tradičně pořádá začátkem prázdnin Letní ŠMF – Školu Matematiky a Fyziky. Na tento tábor pro středoškoláky se mohou přihlásit všichni, kteří se chtějí naučit něco zajímavého z matematiky, fyziky nebo informatiky a zároveň poznat kamarády s podobnými zájmy.
articles.title: Matfyz pořádá letní tábor s matematikou, fyzikou a informatikou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Datová Akademie je prezenční kurz vyvinutý s experty v oblasti datové analýzy. Na kurzu se budete zabývat strukturou a pochopením dat, jejich vizualizací a zpracováním v různých systémech. Postupně projedeme všechny klíčové oblasti a technologie potřebné k práci datového analytika.
articles.title: Datová Akademie: naučte se analyzovat a zpracovat data (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve středu společnost Red Hat oznámila, že kompletní zdrojové kódy distribuce RHEL uzavírá za zákaznický portál. Už tedy nebudou přístupné prostřednictvím gitového repozitáře CentOSu a přístup ke všem opravám budou mít jen platící zákazníci. To samozřejmě komplikuje život tvůrcům odvozených distribucí, jejichž cílem je vytvořit plnohodnotný klon RHEL včetně všech dostupných oprav.
articles.title: Rocky Linux a AlmaLinux reagují na omezení přístupu ke zdrojovým kódům RHEL

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Fedora v současnosti používá GRUB a shim pro start UEFI počítačů. Tak to zůstane i nadále, ale podle návrhu by mělo jít místo GRUB a shim alternativně používat již od instalace systemd-boot, který se již stejně s Fedorou dodává.
articles.title: Fedora ulehčí nasazení systemd-boot jako náhrady GRUBu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Národní laboratoř Argonne a společnost Intel ve čtvrtek oznámily, že nainstalovaly všech 10 624 uzlů pro superpočítač Aurora, který byl ohlášen již v roce 2015. Systém slibuje špičkový teoretický výpočetní výkon přes 2 ExaFLOPS s využitím pole desítek tisíc procesorů Xeon Max Sapphire Rapids s integrovanou pamětí HBM2E a také výpočetních grafických procesorů Max Ponte Vecchio.
articles.title: Nejvýkonnější superpočítač Aurora je nainstalován: 2 ExaFLOPS, desítky tisíc CPU a GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Lol Phirae)
articles.description: Celosvětově nejpoužívanější vyhledávač Google výrazně znepříjemňuje život uživatelům populární služby Hurricane Electric IPv6 Tunnel Broker. Po předchozí krátké epizodě, kdy vynucoval při vyhledávání trénink své AI prostřednictvím vnucování vyplnění reCAPTCHA, nyní přistoupil k úplnému zablokování vyhledávání.
articles.title: Google blokuje vyhledávání přes IPv6 tunely od Hurricane Electric

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Michal Kubeček)
articles.description: Projekt darktable, software pro zpracování fotografií, dnes vydal verzi 4.4.0. Mezi hlavní změny patří vylepšení práce se styly a presety, přepracované rozhraní pro kreslené masky, nabídka alternativního workflow s modulem sigmoid místo filmic rgb a řada výkonnostních vylepšení. Detaily naleznete v podrobném přehledu změn.
articles.title: Vyšel darktable 4.4.0, vylepšuje práci se styly a presety

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Red Hat oznamuje, že odteď bude CentOS Stream jediným místem, kde budou veřejně přístupné zdrojové kódy RHEL a souvisejícího. Platících zákazníků Red Hatu se změna nijak nedotkne, nadále budou mít vše přístupné skrze Red Hat Customer Portal.
articles.title: Zdrojové kódy RHEL už jen skrze CentOS Stream, hlásí Red Hat

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jason Merrill z Red Hatu na webu GNU GCC oznamuje, že projekt schválil svůj Kodex chování (Code of Conduct). Tím se budou nově řídit vývojáři i další přispěvatelé projektu v různých komunikačních systémech jako mailing listech, bugzille, IRC i jinde.
articles.title: GCC má schválen vlastní Kodex chování

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze webového prohlížeče Opera nemá číselné označení 100, ale jmenuje se prostě One. Do vínku dostala vlastní AI zvanou Aria, která je – jak už je u Opery zvykem – přímou součástí prohlížeče, nikoli jen nějaké rozšíření.
articles.title: Nová Opera One integruje vlastní AI Aria s propojením na GPT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chceš začít s programováním? Python je oblíbený programovací jazyk mezi vývojáři i zaměstnavateli a zároveň super vstupenka do světa programování. Nauč se přemýšlet jako programátor a efektivně využívat Python na řešení nejrůznějších problémů. Online Python Akademie znamená celkem 12 týdnů, vždy jedna lekce týdně, večer od 18:00 do 21:00. Následující kurz začíná 12. července.
articles.title: Online Python Akademie: začněte s programováním v oblíbeném jazyce (online kurz)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Knihovna SDL2 v současné nové verzi 2.28 je zkrátka hotova a vývojáři projektu ji překlápí do módu, kdy už bude dvojka jenom opečovávána a novinky už budou směřovat do budoucího vydání SDL3.
articles.title: SDL2 přechází do režimu údržby, vše směřuje k SDL3

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: dmr)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 22. června se uskuteční OWASP Czech chapter meeting, který tentokrát zavítá do Brna. Registrovaným jako vždy nabídne přísun zajímavostí z oblasti IT bezpečnosti a to ve formě dvou večerních přednášek, na které je registrace zcela zdarma. Detaily programu a registraci naleznete na eventbrite.
articles.title: Pozvánka na OWASP Czech chapter meeting 22. června v Brně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Do vydání KDE Plasma 6.0 sice zbývá ještě půl až tři čtvrtě roku, nicméně již nyní Nate Graham hlásí, že pro běžné užití už nepředstavuje problémy a sám ji takto jako hlavní desktop už mnoho týdnů používá. Mírně adrenalinoví uživatelé linuxového desktopu tak mohou naskočit do tohoto next-gen vláčku.
articles.title: Vyzkoušejte KDE Plasma 6, už funguje dobře, hlásí vývojář

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze AV1 kodéru SVT-AV1 1.6 zrychluje kódování AV1 videí v nastaveních s vyšší kvalitou kódování o výtečných 30 až 40 %. Kromě toho došlo k dalšímu ladění parametrů pro profily M1 až M13, vylepšení BD-rate jsou zhruba v rozmezí 1 až 4 % pro výkonnostně rychlejší profily kódování.
articles.title: SVT-AV1 1.6 je o třetinu rychlejší

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Operační systém Tails zavádí v nové verzi 5.14 automatickou migraci na LUKS2 a Argon2id. Důvodem je, že dosud používané šifrování LUKS v Tailsu 5.12 či starších verzích je nedostatečné proti získání přístupu k datům ze strany státní moci držící fyzicky daný počítač / notebook. Tails 5.14 tedy automaticky převede persistentní úložiště na LUKS2 s Argon2id.
articles.title: Tails 5.14 přechází na LUKS2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Pořadatelé konference OpenAlt spustili registraci přednášek a hledají přednášející pro letošní ročník. Ten se uskuteční druhý týden v listopadu, tedy 11. a 12. listopadu 2023 na brněnské Fakultě informatiky Masarykovy univerzity. OpenAlt je fórem, kde se každoročně sdružují lidé, kteří se zajímají o vývoj a používání svobodného a otevřeného softwaru a hardwaru. Otevřený přístup nejen umožňuje opravitelnost a rozšiřitelnost zařízení, ale také poskytuje možnost auditovat zdrojový kód, což přináší vysokou úroveň zabezpečení a soukromí, vysvětluje za organizátory Jozef JoeJoe Mlích.
articles.title: Konference OpenAlt 2023 hledá přednášející

articles.description:
Back on the shores of hell
In 2020, Nightdive Studios released a source port of the oft-forgotten Doom 64 that brought it to modern platforms and reintroduced it to a new, more receptive audience. Beyond simply porting it, however, they added a new episode that better links it to the rest of the Doom series narrative. Now fans have implemented the new episode back into the N64 version as Doom 64: Complete Edition.
This means that if you, for whatever reason (not judging), preferred the N64 version of Doom 64, you can play it again without sacrificing the extra features of Nightdive Studios’ source port. This all sounds really difficult, since the 2020 version runs on Nightdive’s proprietary Kex Engine. I’m assuming the maps still exist in an extractable format because I imagine it would be too much work to try to manually recreate them for a release such as this.
[caption id="attachment_388694" align="alignnone" width="640"] Image via MobyGames[/caption]
Beyond simply adding the extra maps, Doom 64: Complete Edition adds a number of quality-of-life upgrades. You can find them at this link. One of the most important revisions for me, however, is the ability to disable three-point texture filtering. This was what was mostly to blame for everything on the N64 looking blurry. They also improved the framerate in some areas and enabled support for the Expansion Pak upgrade. That’s some good stuff!
If you haven’t played Doom 64, it’s definitely worth checking out. It always had its fans, but Nightdive’s port helped force a wider re-assessment of Midway’s contribution to the series. Personally, I don’t think it’s better than Doom, but I might put it above Doom 2. However, it has its own style and approach to the series’ formula.
The Doom 64: Complete Edition fan patch can be found here.

articles.title: Doom 64 fan mod adds Nightdive’s new episode to N64 version

articles.description:
Why bother?
As is the case whenever an older major third-party franchise gets announced for the Nintendo Switch, eyebrows were raised when the Batman: Arkham Trilogy was revealed in Nintendo's recent Direct presentation. It turns out that skepticism was on point!
According to WB, although the Arkham Trilogy will be sold physically, the cart only contains Batman: Arkham Asylum. Yep, only one of the games in the "trilogy" will be included physically, and you'll need to download the rest. Don't just take it from me, read the entire FAQ entry on the game's official site:
Does the Nintendo Switch physical version of Batman: Arkham Trilogy include all three games on one cartridge?
Batman: Arkham Asylum will be included on the Batman: Arkham Trilogy game cartridge. Batman: Arkham City and Batman: Arkham Knight will require an online connection to download and install both titles when the Batman: Arkham Trilogy cartridge is inserted into the Nintendo Switch console. All three games will then be playable as long as the cartridge is inserted into the Nintendo Switch console.

Welp! At least you get "all previously released DLC" with that download when it comes out this fall!
This is part of a longer trend for third-party games
Although The Witcher 3 managed to cram the game on a higher-capacity cart, many third-party Switch games have suffered the same fate as the Arkham Trilogy. In fact, Arkham wasn't the only series that's fending off criticism in that very same Nintendo Direct, as Konami revealed that Metal Gear Solid Master Collection Vol 1 would also require massive downloads.
Start clearing up your SD space now if you're partaking in either of them later this year.

articles.description:
Possibly next-gen?
We're already painfully aware that Bethesda is taking its sweet time with The Elder Scrolls 6. However, there may be longer to wait still, as even the Head of Xbox Gaming, Phil Spencer, admits he doesn't even know what platform it's going to be on. There may be a few more years to go until the anticipated sequel ever sees the light of day.
And exactly how long are we talking? Well, according to journalist Stephen Totilo, (reporting on the Microsoft/Activision court case), Spencer npted that Elder Scrolls 6 could be "five-plus years away." If true, this would put the elusive Skyrim follow-up on track for a 2028 release at the earliest. As such, it could mean that the long-awaited Bethesda RPG is actually on deck for gaming's next generation.
https://twitter.com/stephentotilo/status/1672314548995366935
According to a recent report from The Verge, Spencer did say in a 2021 interview that it will be exclusive to Xbox, though it doesn't necessarily mean it will be this generation's Xbox. When questioned about this today, the executive doesn't recall ever making such a statement. And so, it stands, we're not really any closer to understanding what's happening with the next Elder Scrolls installment. A couple of years ago, Todd Howard said the game was still in early development.
All we can really hope is that once Starfield is released this September, then Bethesda will be willing to spill a few more beans. We can assume that, for now, the studio is just keeping its cards close to its chest.

articles.title: The Elder Scrolls 6 could still be ‘five-plus’ years away

Battle Beyond the Stars
Bethesda has confirmed that the "Constellation Edition" of its upcoming space opera Starfield will not contain an actual disc of the game itself, and will instead feature a download code for the chosen platform. The publisher noted this controversial development in a tweet from its support team.
"Hello!" said the team, responding directly to a fan's question. "All physical editions include a code for the chosen platform. There are no physical discs". The tweet has since been deleted from Twitter.
The community understandably responded unhappily to the news, with some decrying the return of "non-physical physical editions", while others pointed to the continued slant toward a future where archiving games becomes a much-more-difficult venture without hard copies of the games themselves. The response was overwhelmingly negative, with some, (some as Twitter's Wario64), pointing out that certain adverts for Starfield's physical release had clearly stated that a disc was included.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kfYEiTdsyas
The removal of the initial tweet suggested that there were crossed wires somewhere along the chain of communication. And that indeed proved to be the case, as it now seems that while the standard edition of Starfield will feature a physical disc including game code, it is purely the $250 Constellation Edition that will not — a digital download code for the title being issued as part of this version. And so, anybody who wishes to pick up the Collector's Edition and own a physical disc of the sci-fi spectacle will, at this stage, be required to pick up both versions.

The DDOS attack has since passed, and the dungeon-crawling sequel is, as of this writing, fully playable once again.
While players started noticing issues late Saturday, the attack was first noted by the studio itself on the morning of Sunday, when a brief message posted to Twitter said that the team was "currently investigating an issue affecting our authentication servers". Players had noticed that they were unable to log in to titles such as Diablo 4 and World of Warcraft during this time. The studio then confirmed that it was undergoing a DDOS attack, wherein parties intently overrun a server with requests, causing an information lockup or even a full collapse.
https://twitter.com/BlizzardCS/status/1673082677115666440?s=20
Later that day, Blizzard announced that the attack had ended and that normal service had been resumed. The DDOS attack effectively lasted less than a day but, given that it was Sunday, it no doubt cut into some valuable playing time for those who are only able to delve into Blizzard's worlds during the weekend hours. Malicious DDOS attacks remain a problem for online communities, whether targeted at specific websites or full gaming networks and streaming services.

articles.author: Andrew Heaton
articles.description:
And it's only for Partners
Twitch is forever altering the way it allows content creators to make money, but it usually comes with a drawback or two. Take the recent changes to revenue splits. Some felt that this was a step in the right direction, but given that the new program comes with a bunch of boxes that need to be ticked, not everyone can benefit.
Now, there's a new feature that's being implemented, which could also be seen in a less-than-good light for most. According to a recent blog post, Twitch is introducing "Hype Chat," a feature that gives viewers the chance to literally buy chat messages. The idea behind it is to let users "stand out" in the overall chat.
[caption id="attachment_388337" align="aligncenter" width="572"] Image via Twitch.[/caption]
Amounts that can be paid for messages vary from $1 to $500 (though Twitch says that streamers can set a minimum amount up to $100). Depending on how much a viewer pays will depend on the duration of the pinned comment, as well as character length, and the visual design. All this while affording the person streaming the ability to "earn a share of the revenue from each Hype Chat purchase."
But, as usual, not everyone will get the benefit of this new feature. The blog post goes on to say that Hype Chat is only available to Partners, so smaller channels will miss out. However, the Amazon-owned service does say that it may look into implementing this "more broadly" in the future.
For some, though, it may be too little too late to win back support. With big streaming names like xQc and Amouranth already jumping ship to rival platform Kick, things are looking a bit tough for Twitch right now, though it should be noted that it is still pulling in millions of users each month.

Old-school cool developer Sunsoft has announced that it is planning a crowdfunding campaign in hopes to bring three of its Japan-only Famicom releases to modern platforms. The campaign will officially launch on the Japanese crowdfunding site Campfire between July 14 - August 31.
The three titles up for rerelease are Edo-set platformer Kanshaku Tamanage Kantarou no Toukaidou Gojuusan-tsugi (1986), side-scrolling fantasy adventure The Wing of Madoola (1986), and finally the casually-paced text adventure Ripple Island (1988). None of the titles ventured outside of Japan and thus have since faded into obscurity, a status that Sunsoft is hoping to revitalize.
[caption id="attachment_388355" align="alignnone" width="640"] Image from Shmuplations[/caption]
Should the Campfire campaign prove successful, the three titles will be ported to PC and Nintendo Switch. In addition, the publisher is hoping to release physical gold cartridges of the games for the Famicom platform. Way back when, Sunsoft was one of the few companies allowed to release its titles on specially branded cartridges, (see image above), and while many of the studio's games were awarded this prestige, gold-tinted cartridges were a goal never achieved by the studio. Hopefully, Sunsoft will be able to realize its glittery dream, if 40 years after the fact.
Localizations for the titles were not confirmed, and seem unlikely, but we will let you know should this change.
Sunsoft plans crowdfunding campaign to port three Famicom titles to Switch, PC [Gematsu]

In the latest episode of the Kinda Funny Xcast, Howard is asked a bunch of questions regarding the game. About 14 minutes in, he's asked whether there's going to be any "space fishing" in Starfield. Howard begins his answer by saying that it "depends on your definition of 'fishing'," curious as to whether it refers to the collecting or killing of fish.
https://youtu.be/AIbnDyv6g1c?t=880
Co-host Gary then gets more specific by asking whether he'll be able to have "some kind of rod" that can be put into a lake in order to retrieve a fish. Howard then crushes Gary's (and probably other people's) hopes by confirming that the game does not have that feature. However, this does open up the possibility of it being including in an update, expansion, or even something modders could implement.
As we know, Skyrim was given a fishing feature for the Anniversary Edition that dropped in November 2021. Given this, it's not too far-fetched to consider that Bethesda may add this peaceful hobby to Starfield at some point in the future. But that's just speculation on our part.
When it comes to open world games, players like to take a step back from the action for a bit. The chance to do a spot of fishing while exploring an alien world sounds appealing, so it's a bit of a shame that Starfield won't have it on release.

It looks like two vehicles driven by the most famous doll in the world are preparing to hit the garages of dazzling arcade racer Forza Horizon 5 — The Corvette and Hummer driven by Margot Robbie in upcoming movie, Barbie, will be arriving in-game at some point in the near future.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E_RsVstmcls
The two vehicles were noted by Forza fan IdleSloth, who spotted placeholders in the game's Promo menu. The two cars featured are the "1956 Barbie Movie Corvette EV", (featured in the Chevrolet section), and the "2022 Barbie Movie Hummer EV Pickup", (featured under GMC). Videos of the vehicles in Showcase Mode were later uploaded by another Forza devotee, Aziial.
No dates for the drop have been announced, so it is assumed the two *electric vehicles will arrive as free downloads or in-game rewards to cross-promote the movie itself, which premieres July 21.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wN7qCE4uI_s
Directed by Greta Gerwig, Barbie follows the adventures of the titular doll, as she and her long-time pal Ken (Ryan Gosling) leave Barbieland to visit the "real world" and get a taste of reality. A huge ensemble cast includes Simu Liu, Kate McKinnon, Will Ferrell, Michael Cera, America Ferrara, Issa Rae, and Helen Mirren. Response to recent trailers has been extremely positive, and all that's left is the waiting game before we find out with the talent both in front of and behind the lens can live up to the hype.
Forza Horizon 5 is available now on PC and Xbox platforms. Barbie premieres in U.S. theaters July 21.
The post Barbie’s curvy Corvette is coming to Forza Horizon 5 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Barbie’s curvy Corvette is coming to Forza Horizon 5

The update was announced in November 2022 as part of the game's 2023 roadmap.

The Sonic's Birthday Bash update adds new challenges, moves, and a new kind of collectible Koco for Sonic. The update also promises free birthday decorations for our hero, as well as the addition of New Game Plus. As is standard with most New Game Plus modes, you can begin the adventure from the start with all of your skill tree and power-up levels carried over into the new file.

Sonic's Birthday Bash arrives free to download beginning today at 5 p.m. PT / 8 p.m. ET. The first of three content updates arrived in March, adding a photo mode, Cyber Space Challenges, and Battle Rush mode, plus a jukebox featuring collectible songs from Sonic's past. The third update, which promises to be the most substantial, adds new playable characters and a new story and is set to arrive later this year. Today’s Nintendo Direct revealed that Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1, the enhanced bundle of classic Metal Gear games previously announced at the PlayStation Showcase, is also headed to Switch. We also have a better idea of what it entails including a release date. 

Arriving on October 24, this package is headlined by its HD remasters of Metal Gear Solid (including the VR/Special missions), Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty, and Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. However, it also includes Metal Gear (both the NES and MSX versions), Snake’s Revenge, and Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake.

Bonus content includes strategy guides for each game, the Metal Gear Solid 1 and 2 digital graphic novels, screenplay and master books, and a digital soundtrack. 

Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1 is headed to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch, and PC.

Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is speeding closer to the end of its six waves of Booster Course Pass DLC, which is said to wrap up before the end of this year. During today's Nintendo Direct, we got our first details on Wave 5 of the Booster Course Pass DLC, which is set to hit within the next couple of months.

Booster Course Pass Wave 5 will feature an all-new course in the bathroom-themed Squeaky Clean Sprint, as well as three new characters. Petey Piranha, who made his debut in Mario Kart: Double Dash; Wiggler, who debuted in Mario Kart 7; and Kamek, who appears in Mario Kart Tour (and was a character in Mario Kart 64 before being replaced by Donkey Kong in the retail version) are all set to join the roster of playable racers in this wave of DLC. Seven more courses will join the pack as well, but we have no indication of which tracks those will be just yet. You can see the announcement trailer below.

Wave 5 of the Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Booster Course Pass arrives this summer. The Booster Course Pass is included as a part of the Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscription plan, or you can buy the DLC pack itself for $25.
articles.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Wave 5 DLC Includes Brand New Course, Three Returning Characters

articles.description:
Star Ocean: The Second Story is getting an HD-2D overhaul that slaps the letter R at the end of the title, a nod to the fact that it’s a remake.

The game first launched for PlayStation in 1998 (1999 in the U.S.) and stars protagonists Claude, a human federation officer, and Rena, a mystically powered girl, who players choose to control in separate campaigns. The game heavily emphasizes decision-making as your choices determine which of many playable allies you meet along the way join your party. 

This enhanced remake includes a modernized version of the game’s real-time combat; players can now stun enemies with chain attacks. Another cool addition is that party members not in combat can still lend a hand by executing assist-style follow-up attacks.

Star Ocean The Second Story R launches November 2 for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC.

During today's Nintendo Direct, the company announced the two other stars, Zelda and Ganondorf, are also set to receive Amiibo figures.

While the Tears of the Kingdom Link Amiibo is somewhat disappointing in its functionality (mostly the same as its Breath of the Wild counterpart), it provides special fabric for Link's paraglider. It appears as though fans should expect similar functionality from the upcoming Zelda and Ganondorf Amiibo figures, as the press release promises "valuable in-game items, as well as special fabric for the paraglider." 

The Tears of the Kingdom Zelda and Ganondorf Amiibo figures arrive later this holiday season. articles.description:
Today’s Nintendo Direct ended with the reveal of a new 2D Mario game called Super Mario Bros. Wonder. Before you ask, this is not a new “New” Super Mario Bros. This brand-new adventure sports a revamped art style (and more expressive characters) and stars the familiar foursome of Mario, Luigi, Peach, and Toad in addition to Daisy and Yoshi.

The 2D worlds sport trippy features caused by a new power-up called the Wonder Flower. This transforms the world and gameplay in unexpected ways; pipes come to life, Mario can stretch his body to absurd lengths, and hordes of stampeding rhinos can appear, among other wacky effects. The biggest gasp came from a new power-up that transformed Mario into an elephant. Yes, you read that right. Mario's an elephant now, and it looks delightfully ridiculous. 

Super Mario Bros. Wonder looks like a trip, and it launches on October 20.
articles.title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder Is The Next 2D Mario Platformer

Nintendo and Rocksteady have revealed Batman: Arkham Trilogy, a new trilogy collection that brings Batman: Arkham Asylum, Arkham City, and Arkham Knight to Switch later this year. 

More specifically, the Arkham Trilogy is due out this fall and promises to allow players to experience "the definitive versions of Rocksteady's Arkham Trilogy games." This trilogy also includes all post-launch content, including DLC expansions, suits, Batmobiles, and more. All three of these games have been available elsewhere for years but this trilogy marks the first time Switch players can play through all three games. 

Check out Batman: Arkham Trilogy in the reveal trailer below: 

Unfortunately, this trilogy does not include the (pretty great) Batman: Arkham Origins, which wasn't developed by Rocksteady; it was developed by Gotham Knights developer WB Games Montreal. However, the three games in this trilogy are still great, so it's still a good get for the Switch platform.
articles.title: Batman: Arkham Trilogy Hits Switch This Fall

Whether you played the originals in 2001 and 2004 on GameCube, or you’ve always been curious to try out those early games in the franchise, Nintendo is providing a chance to explore the games once again. HD versions of both projects are headed into the Nintendo eShop today.

Both games were critically lauded in their day for the creative approach they took to puzzles and problem solving, as well as the charming presentation and setting.
articles.title: HD Versions Of Pikmin 1 and Pikmin 2 Arrive Today

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Nintendo has announced WarioWare: Move It, a new game in the long-running microgame series. 

The company revealed this during today's Nintendo Direct, highlighting the unique ways players can use two Joy-Con (and body movement) to complete microgames. One example shows a player using Joy-Con to balance Mario sliding in Super Mario 64. There's also plenty of first-person Wario action as well, with one microgame showing Wario trying to break out of what appears to be a jail cell. 

As you'd expect, WarioWare: Move It features a very unique, albeit strange, art style. Plus, it features two-player local co-op and a special Party Mode that allows up to four players to play various microgames together. 

WarioWare: Move It hits Switch on November 3.
articles.title: WarioWare: Move It Announced, Releasing This November

The best vampire bullet hell with no vampires has scooped up numerous rewards for its satisfying, hard-to-put-down action and gameplay loop. It's a great fit for a handheld (as Steam Deck players will attest). Best of all, this version supports four-player couch co-op. Check out the new trailer below.

As you might expect, Penny's Big Breakaway is a colorful platformer with a focus on movement and traversal. Here's the game's full description:

"In this 3D platforming adventure, you’ll explore the bright and colorful world of Macaroon, and help Penny and Yo-Yo escape the clutches of the grouchy Emperor Eddie. Perform stylish, acrobatic tricks to avoid Eddie’s massive horde of pushy penguins in Story Mode. Power up Yo-Yo to protect Penny and put your speed running skills to the test in Time Attack Mode to unlock special items and complete secret stages."

You can check out a trailer below:

Penny's Big Breakaway is being made by Evening Star Studio, founded in 2018. This is its first game as a company.

articles.description:
Persona 5 Tactica was announced recently through the Xbox Games Showcase, but details on gameplay were limited. Today’s Nintendo Direct brought us a closer look at the game while highlighting the project's appearance on Switch consoles.

In the game, the group from Persona 5 is pulled into a new world, where they join forces with a new character named Erina, who is fighting as a revolutionary against the prevailing power in that place.

Gameplay allows for both up-close and ranged attacks over the course of its turn-based tactics encounters, but you can also use Personas to get your point across. Knocking enemies down opens up the “One More” action to double up damage. The game also encourages canny positioning choices, since surrounding your foes with three characters opens up the “Triple Threat” ability to deal big damage.

Drawing from the capability seen in Persona 5, you can also fuse Personas to create new ones.

Persona 5 Tactica is coming to PlayStation and Xbox consoles, as well as Switch, on November 17.

It's called Detective Pikachu Returns, and the chatty, gruff-voiced Pikachu and his human partner Tim Goodman have a new batch of mysteries to solve in Ryme City. While we don't have a great sense of the game's plot or features, we'd wager there's plenty of investigative gameplay and puzzle-solving.

The first Detective Pikachu launched in 2016 for 3DS and was adapted into a live-action film in 2019.  We'll have to watch out to learn more about this follow-up in the coming weeks.

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Princess Peach will star as the main character in a new game coming to Switch next year. 

Nintendo announced this during today's Nintendo Direct, stopping short of really any details beyond that. The company didn't reveal a name or any details about gameplay, but it did actually show gameplay and it looks exactly how you'd expect. We control Peach in a 3D world that looks reminiscent of something we'd see in a Super Mario RPG.

One interesting thing the Direct did reveal was that when Peach steps on a special pedestal, her outfit changes, going from her usual pink dress to a bright, light blue dress that seems to indicate she's powered up in some way. But the reveal ends there, with Nintendo promising more information at a later date. The last game to star Peach as the main character was 2005's Super Princess Peach for DS.

articles.description:
The next game coming to Nintendo Switch Online is Fire Emblem. 

More specifically, Nintendo has announced that the Game Boy Advance version of Fire Emblem, otherwise known as Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade, is coming to its subscription service for all Expansion Pack subscribers next week on June 23. This is the seventh game in the Fire Emblem series but the first in the franchise to be localized for audiences outside of Japan. It first hit the U.S. in 2003. 

A prequel to Fire Emblem: The Blinding Blade, this game takes place on the continent of Elibe and follows Lyn, Eliwood, and Hector. As you might expect, combat movement takes place on a grid of squares before transitioning to animated attacks. There are different character classes and weapons, and characters who die do so permanently. 

Fire Emblem joins Harvest Moon, Kirby Tilt 'n' Tumble, and two more games announced for Nintendo Switch Online last week. While waiting for Fire Emblem to hit the library on June 23, read Game Informer's review of Fire Emblem Engage. 

Are you going to check out Fire Emblem next week? Let us know in the comments below!

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
More than 16 months into a war the Kremlin anticipated would be over in roughly three days, authorities in Russia continue to come up with 'innovative' ideas to limit the severity of the damage inflicted on its own entertainment sector. The latest plan is to start unblocking thousands of pirate sites but only if they comply with a set of stringent conditions they already ignore.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Russia Could Unblock Pirate Sites If They Agree to Censor Their Catalogs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Extraction 2' tops the chart, followed by 'Fast X'. ‘John Wick: Chapter 4' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 06/26/2023

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The Interplanetary File System provides technical resilience against censorship but, for those who offer IPFS gateways, pressure to self-censor is mounting. Reports indicate that major publishing companies are carpet-bombing these volunteers with tens of thousands of DMCA notices, despite being fully aware that they are not responsible for the content in question and cannot take it down. One gateway operator has already called it quits.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Publishers Carpet-Bomb IPFS Gateway Operators With DMCA Notices

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Pirate IPTV services have transformed into a billion-dollar industry in recent years. It is a highly profitable business that, at the upper echelon, appears to be well organized. However, research from the Digital Citizens Alliance shows that handing over credit card details to unknown parties also has its drawbacks, including 'surprise' charges. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sharing Your Credit Card With a Shady Pirate IPTV Service Isn’t a Brilliant Idea

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
By pretending to be legitimate music rightsholders, two men managed to extract over $23 million in revenue from YouTube's content-ID system. Both were arrested, pleaded guilty, and now face multi-year prison terms. This week, the U.S. requested a 70-month sentence against the 'number two' of the operation, in part to deter future fraud.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: U.S. Seeks 70-Month Prison Sentence for YouTube Content ID Scammer

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italian police say they have targeted 13 people in Italy and Germany suspected of selling access to pirate IPTV services. Italian police units collaborated with their counterparts in Germany, with international judicial cooperation channels coordinated by Eurojust. Police say they seized over 620,000 euros in cash and crypto, and shut down 60 Telegram channels.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV: Police Target 13 Suspects, Seize 620K Euros in Cash/Crypto

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Since 2012, Kim Dotcom has been fighting extradition to the United States where he faces serious charges related to cloud storage site Megaupload. During that time, very little has been said about Megaupload graphic designer, Julius Bencko. A wanted man in the U.S., Bencko was arrested this month by armed police in the Czech Republic, who filmed the event and published it online.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Megaupload Fugitive Arrested By Armed Police 11 Years After The Raid

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
'AI Hub' is a rapidly growing Discord server where users share guides and AI models, including voice models of major musicians. The RIAA suggests that the server is dedicated to copyright infringement and wants it shut down. Through a DMCA subpoena, the anti-piracy group further asks Discord to disclose the identities of several users.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RIAA Targets ‘AI Hub’ Discord Users Over Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Through a California federal court, a group of filmmakers wants Reddit to disclose the identities of several users who made piracy-related comments. The filmmakers say the users could provide key evidence in an ongoing lawsuit against Internet provider Grande. In line with its response to a similar request earlier this year, Reddit objects once again, citing its users' right to anonymous speech.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Filmmakers Take Reddit to Court Again to Unmask ‘Piracy’ Commenters

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
With tens of millions of regular monthly visitors, South Korean piracy site Noonoo TV made powerful enemies. The stand-off reached the boiling point in March when broadcasters formed a new anti-piracy coalition and warned of punishing legal action. Noonoo TV responded by throwing in the towel but after clone site 'Noonoo TV Season 2' appeared online, the government says it will develop an AI anti-piracy system that will stop any 'Season 3' variants in their tracks.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Korea Will Deploy ‘Anti-Piracy AI’ After Major Piracy Site Reincarnation

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The US Copyright Claims Board allows rightsholders to file damages claims outside of the federal court system. Since its official launch last year, hundreds of cases have been presented to the board. Typical copyright trolls were noticeably absent and thus far there's been just one award for damages, as the vast majority of all claims are dismissed.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Copyright Claims Board Celebrates First Anniversary Without a Troll Party

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
There are fears that Russia's black-market supply of unlicensed Hollywood movies could soon dry up. Cinema insiders say Kazakhstan-based company 'WesternRus" had been supplying keys to cinema chains to unlock localized mainstream movies. Announcing an indefinite suspension of its activities, WesternRus cited "high levels of piracy" as the main reason for throwing in the towel.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Movie Supplier Quits After Russian Pirates Cammed its Pirate Releases

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
A recent publication by the Audiovisual Anti-Piracy Alliance signals app piracy as a growing problem that has room for improvement. Rightsholders could collaborate more intensely with app stores, for example. Meanwhile, app platforms could implement know-your-customer verification, while deploying automated tools to scan for and filter apps that use known pirate keywords.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Anti-Piracy Group Signals Opportunities to Tackle Online Piracy Apps

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
At the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar, defending champions France couldn't prevent Argentina from lifting the trophy. Back on home soil, French telecoms regulator Arcom blocked 83 domains during the tournament but couldn't prevent some fans from streaming games illegally. The conundrum for Arcom is that if it cracked down on the most prolific football pirates, it would also be cracking down on the fans most likely to use paid, legal services.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Most Prolific World Cup Pirates Also Most Likely to Use a Paid Service

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Copyright holders have sent billions of takedown requests to Google. Their goal is to make it harder for people to find pirated content through the search engine. However, when legal options such as Reelgood are targeted, takedown requests can end up being counterproductive.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A researcher who alerted Sky to a security hole that allowed anyone to watch NOW TV subscription channels for free claims the problem went unfixed for months. Emails seen by TorrentFreak show that Sky was made aware of the piracy loophole in January 2023 but encryption keys were still working until at least early June. What Sky could've actually done is unclear.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sky ‘Free NOW TV’ Security Hole Exposed For Months, Researcher Claims

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar

The Motion Picture Association sees the open-source Android app Cloudstream as a gateway to pirated streams. This week, the anti-piracy group successfully removed two 'infringing' code repositories from GitHub but a stripped-down version of the application remains unscathed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: GitHub Takes Down Cloudstream APK Code Repo Following MPA Complaint

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The International Broadcaster Coalition Against Piracy and member DISH Network have emerged victorious in a long-running lawsuit against pirate set-top box distributor Jadoo TV. This week a California court granted summary judgment, finding Jadoo TV and CEO Sajid Sohail liable for direct, contributory, and vicarious infringement. Personal liability for Sohail is significant given Jadoo TV's ongoing bankruptcy proceedings.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: IBCAP/DISH Prevail in Jadoo TV Piracy Lawsuit, CEO Held Personally Liable

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
After signing a plea deal in 2022 to avoid extradition to the United States, former Megaupload coders Mathias Ortmann and Bram van der Kolk have been sentenced in New Zealand. The High Court in Auckland handed down prison sentences of 31 and 30 months respectively. Both had faced up to 10 years behind bars but guilty pleas, cooperation and rehabilitation all played a part in reducing their sentences.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Former Megaupload Executives Sentenced to 2.5 Years in Prison

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (DreamMaster)
articles.description:
A stalwart party exploring the unknown, seeking the fabled Inner Sanctum. But all is not what it seems in the world of Varn...
The ScummVM Team is pleased to announce full support for the PC version of the first game of the Might and Magic series: Might and Magic Book One: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum. Two modes are supported:
The original look and feel of the game (sound, which in the original consisted of merely the occasional beep, is not supported)
A ScummVM-exclusive enhanced mode, which uses the interface of the later Xeen games, including niceties such as better character screens, automapping, and sound effects. It also integrates the impressive "Might and Magic 1 Graphics Overhaul Mod", which provides better in-game map and monster graphics. The xeen.cc file is required from Might and Magic: IV or Might and Magic: World of Xeen.
Both modes allow saving your game anywhere outside of combat via the ScummVM Global Main Menu (unlike the original game that only saved a single roster when checking into an inn). So make sure you save regularly, just in case you encounter problems.
Help us test both game modes by grabbing a daily build and adding mm.dat to the same folder as your game files. Read through our testing guidelines, and please take some screenshots along the way.
Now, go forth, and discover the true secrets of the game that started the long running epic fantasy series!
>
articles.title: Journey Now Into an Age of Chivalry in an Alternate Reality

articles.description:
Schizm: Mysterious Journey, the second supported game of the V-Cruise engine, is ready for public testing!
Created in 2001 by Detalion and published by LK Avalon, this acclaimed 3D-rendered panoramic first-person adventure has you puzzle your way through an alien world as a team of two scientists split up when their ship crash-landed on the planet.
ScummVM currently supports the DVD and digital English releases (with subtitles in Dutch, English, French, German, Italian, Polish, Spanish, Greek, and Russian). If you’re aware of any other versions, please contact us.
To play any of these supported releases, you will need a daily development build. If you encounter any issues, please submit them to the issue tracker!

articles.description: Only a day after 13.2, we present 13.3. And there is a bit of a story here. But in short: we made a mistake with 13.2.1, and need to release a 13.3 with no functional change to make sure multiplayer games work as expected.
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.3

articles.description: As I write this many of the development team and other members of the community are busy having fun at a meet-up in Brussels. Not me though, I’m stuck here doing a release. We’ve been busy refactoring quite a lot of the underlying code to make future changes easier, but along the way we’ve found and fixed a few more bugs and quality of life improvements that we figured were worth releasing sooner than whenever 14.0 comes along. Notably, OpenTTD will now automatically disable hardware acceleration if it detects that the last crash happened while initialising the graphics driver. While hardware acceleration works well for the vast majority of people, it causes crashes for people that then required command line arguments or manual config file editing to get it to work. This should be a better solution for those users. Additionally, there is a change to the default mouse mode on Linux to improve experience when dragging the map (and often to match expected behaviour in other games). As always, there are plenty of other bugfixes, which you can find in the changelog. While you’re at it, have you seen the post about the upcoming addition of a automated opt-in survey to OpenTTD 14? If you have opinions, we’d like to hear them! Details here. Download Changelog Bug tracker
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.2
